intro: Pimpinella saxifraga var. pratensis, commonly known as field cow-wheat, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and along stream banks, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with finely divided leaflets that give it a delicate appearance. This variety is often found in temperate regions of Europe and is known for its role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
